alert.note: Alert for Caddo (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued February 26 at 8:25PM CST until February 26 at 8:45PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Central Caddo County in southwestern Oklahoma... * Until 845 PM CST. * At 825 PM CST, a tornado producing storm was located near Fort Cobb Reservoir, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * Locations impacted include... Hinton, Binger, Fort Cobb, Eakly, Lookeba, Fort Cobb Reservoir, Alfalfa and Albert. This includes Interstate 40 near mile marker 99. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a storm shelter, safe room or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
